channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly-tipped furniture blocking back door and creating fire hazard, 18th June
item.description:
Hello, Someone has dumped large furniture items directly in front of the back door to my property, completely blocking access. This is not only an obstruction but also poses a serious fire safety hazard. Could this please be removed as soon as possible? Thank you for your support.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48-50, Artillery Place, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic gate left open, 18th June
item.description:
The traffic gate is left open every week by bin collection, this leads to speeding through the estate, using it as a race track. I have been threatened and told I will be ‘cut up’ when I challenged them. If this continues a child could get knocked over.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lyme Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking my drive, 18th June
item.description:
The vehicle that I am reporting has been abandoned since March 2025. No license as far as I can see and no MOT. It is making driving into my drive extremely difficult. This is a vicarage and parishioners visit frequently but blocking the path is not acceptable

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wernbrook Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water issue, 18th June
item.description:
This has been going on for some time, our front wall is constantly wet and will be causing damage to our foundations. Thames water advised me to inform you so you can liase with them as the leak isn't on our property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Pleydell Avenue, Crystal Palace, London

item.title: Road painting - yellow line refresh, 18th June
item.description:
Within the last two weeks the road painting team came to refresh the yellow lines along our road. However the road sweeper hadn’t been for ages so all the Scots pine tree needles and cones were in the way. The road sweeper came this week so can you please send the painters back to refresh our lines before the road gets dirty again?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Otford Close, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging trees/bushes in Graham Rd DA6, 18th June
item.description:
Over grown trees and bushes on Graham Road DA6 7EG near Sherbert Close – used to be pop in parlour wellbeing place has been closed for a while -– bushes have stinging nettles and getting very high and dangerous – lots of elderly walk past and her granddaughter had been stung from the nettles before
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Graham Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
